Legal basis: Law on Employment in 2013 and Decree 28/2015/ND-CP.

I. Procedures for receiving unemployment allowance in Vietnam

1. Conditions for unemployment allowance receipt

(1) Terminating the labor contract or working contract, except the following cases:

- He/she unilaterally terminates the labor contract or working contract in contravention of law;

- He/she receives monthly pension or working capacity loss allowance.

(2) Having paid unemployment insurance premiums for at least full 12 months within 24 months before terminating the labor contracts or working contracts of indefinite time and definite time;

Having paid unemployment insurance premiums for at least full 12 months within 36 months before terminating the seasonal or job-based working contracts with a term of between full 3 months and under 12 months.

(3) Having submitted a dossier for receipt of unemployment allowance to an employment service center .

(4) Having not yet found any job after 15 days from the date of submission of the dossier for receipt of unemployment allowance, except the cases prescribed in Clause 4 Article 49 of the Law on Employment in 2013.

2. Application for unemployment allowance in Vietnam

The application include:

(1) A written form of unemployment allowance.

(2) An original or certified true copy of one of the following documents certifying the termination of the labor contract or working contract:

+ The labor contract or working contract expired or terminated under its term;

+ The resignation decision;

+ The dismission decision;

+ Disciplinary decisions on dismissal;

+ The written notice or agreement of termination of the labor contract or working contract.

(3) Social insurance books

3. Procedures for receiving unemployment allowance in Vietnam

Step 1: Submission of application

Within 03 months from the date of termination of labor contract or working contract, employees who have no jobs and need unemployment benefit shall directly submit 01 application for unemployment benefits to employment service center in the locality where employees want to receive unemployment benefits.

Step 2: Decision to grant unemployment allowance to the employees

Employment service centers shall receive, inspect the applications, record the appointment paper of reply in the form defined by the Minister of Labor, War Invalids and Social Affairs and give it directly to the applicants application or sent by post to the applicants submitting the application by post;

If the applications are not in accordance with the provisions, employment service centers shall return to the applicants and state clearly the reason.

Employment service centers shall consider, request the Director of the Services of Labour, War Invalids and Social Affairs for decision on unemployment benefits of employees within 20 working days from receipt of a satisfactory application in accordance with regulations

Note: If the application is submitted by post, the date of receipt shall be the date stamped on the postmark.

Step 3: Payment of unemployment allowance

- Social insurance organization shall pay unemployment benefit for the first month of the employees within 05 working days from receipt of the decision of unemployment benefits;

+ Social insurance organizations shall pay unemployment benefit for the employees from the second unemployment benefit month onwards within 05 working days from the 07th day of the month of unemployment benefit if they do not receive a decision of suspension or termination of unemployment benefit for the employees.

Note: If the above 07th day is a holiday, the payment deadline of unemployment benefits shall be the next working day.

4. Competence for handling:

- The employment service center receives and examines the documents, issues appointment tickets for result delivery, and directly hands them over to the employees.

- The Director of the Department of Labour, War Invalids and Social Affairs decides on the entitlement to unemployment benefits for the employees.

- The social insurance agency is responsible for disbursing unemployment benefits to the employees.

5. Deadline for processing the application: 20 working days from the date of receiving a complete set of documents as prescribed.
